byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

abstract: Pierre Boulez, illustrious French composer and conductor emeritus of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra whose dynamic ambition helped modernize classical music in the 20th century, dies at age 90; is lauded for composing celebrated piece Marteau Sans Maitre, and juggled positions as music director of New York Philharmonic and the BBC Symphony Orchestra, among other positions.

headline.print_headline: Pierre Boulez, Music’s Uncompromising Modernist, Dies at 90
headline.main: Pierre Boulez, Composer and Conductor Who Pushed Modernism’s Boundaries, Dies at 90

snippet: Mr. Boulez belonged to an extraordinary generation of European composers who, while in their 20s, came to the forefront during the decade or so after World War II.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Boulez belonged to an extraordinary generation of European composers who, while in their 20s, came to the forefront during the decade or so after World War II.
